title: US LNG exports to double over next 5 years – S&P
subtitle: (Montel) US LNG exports – which reached a record of 243bcm in 2024, according to Kpler data – are set to double over the next five years, said analysis firm S&P Global, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday.
body:
This came on the back of plans by US president-elect Donald Trump to ramp up production, which could provide a USD 1.3 trillion boost to the domestic economy, added S&P in a new report, according to the UK business daily.
After a pause amid environmental concerns instituted by the Biden administration, the oil and gas industry is poised to get approval to build new export facilities and pipelines in the Gulf of Mexico.
“Contracts in place”“We already have large contracts in place with major LNG suppliers and we certainly expect to get more of that,” said Alan Armstrong, chief executive of Williams, one of the largest gas pipeline companies in the US.
The US LNG export market has been a key for European supply since the curtailment of Russian gas flows amid the fallout from the Ukraine war and Trump has vowed to roll back regulations, appointing former North Dakota governor Doug Burgum as secretary of the interior, tasked with slashing red tape. 
Given this approach, Anatol Feygin, COO of US energy major Cheniere, told the FT the country would remain the world’s biggest exporter of the chilled fuel for decades to come.
